content: [hakon] "Because I want to make the best decisions for what's left of us varl."
[hakon] "Ha! You're right - we'd be at war."
[hakon] "I...don't want to be remembered as the king who led them to their deaths."
[hakon] "I just lost half of my people in the Old Wood!"
[hakon] "It just seems like they were better prepared to lead our kind than I am."
[hakon] "I wonder what the old kings, like Throstr and Skrymir, would do in my place."

content.option: "They probably wouldn't talk to a human."
"They would've kept their people alive. Same as you."

content: [hakon] "Let's get what we need and get going. Maybe it'll be as easy as you make it sound."
/=Hakon looks at you, the confusion leaving his face.=/
[hakon] "That hasn't been our luck. No sense thinking things will change now."
[hakon] "The capital's only a few days away now."
[$hero] "I know. I'd like to believe we'll make it without any more problems, but--"
[$hero] "It's like Iver told me, you can't prepare for a giant Serpent attacking. Not even ancient kings could do that."
[$hero] "Just keep them alive. No matter what happens in Arberrang, protect your people."
[$hero] "That's probably just skald songs making it seem that way."
[$hero] "Then keep them alive. No matter what happens in Arberrang, protect your people."
/=The thought of fighting Hakon and his varl makes you shiver.=/
/=You give the varl an encouraging smile. It's the best you can do.=/
/=You laugh a little but notice the distant look in Hakon's eyes as he looks towards the varl tents.=/
